runners.comment: Clearcut win at Lingfield on Wednesday; strong claims under penalty; declared yesterday
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) this winter, the latest on Wednesday in clearcut fashion; has shown promise here; strong candidate under a 5lb penalty; declared 2.20 Lingfield yesterday.

runners.comment: Nine course wins, the latest on Thursday in fine style; major player under a 4lb penalty
runners.name: Sir Rodneyredblood
runners.spotlight: 9yo who posted course win number nine when returning to form on Thursday (6f); five of those course wins have been at 5f; had just over 4l to spare last time and he's a major player under a 4lb penalty.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but has been hinting that this very rare crack at 5f could be a good move
runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and down the field at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) ten days ago but prior to that he was a close third there (6f) and he's been hinting that this very rare crack at 5f could be a good move; has won on Polytrack elsewhere; possible contender.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but not beaten far at Newcastle on Friday and could be thereabouts
runners.name: What What What
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 17 starts but he's finished fourth on his last four outings and has been getting closer to the target each time, most recently beaten just over 1l at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) on Friday; could be thereabouts on his first encounter with Polytrack.

runners.comment: Running okay this winter (including Polytrack) but needs something extra in 1st-time visor
runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.spotlight: Sole win (from 13 attempts) came at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) in October; he's run okay on his last three starts (including on Polytrack) but needs something extra in the first-time visor if he's to come out on top today.

runners.comment: He's tumbled down the weights after struggling on his last four starts
runners.name: Inconspicuous
runners.spotlight: Ran well at Wolverhampton last February and has tumbled down the weights after struggling on his four runs since, most recently last month's stable debut at Southwell.

runners.comment: A couple of reasonable efforts among her last three starts but her losing run continues
runners.name: Second Collection
runners.spotlight: A couple of reasonable efforts among her last three starts, twice finishing fourth, but this 10yo has now been beaten in each of her last 18 outings and has to raise her game if she's to return to winning ways.

14:12.race_name: Betfred Best Odds All Races Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: In decent form with three sound placed efforts in December; sound each-way chance
runners.name: Lady Wingalong
runners.spotlight: Comes into this in decent form with three sound placed runs in December, last time finishing a close second over 6f at Wolverhampton; ran creditably on only previous start here; sound each-way chance.

runners.comment: Ex-Clive Cox; bought 2,000gns in October; off the mark in 5f novice here; should go well
runners.name: Middleton View
runners.spotlight: Ex-Clive Cox; bought for 2,000gns in October and was off the mark on stable debut in a 5f novice here in December (first-time tongue-tie); step back up in trip should suit and is one to consider.

runners.comment: Overcame problems in running to win over C&D last time; just 1lb higher; contender
runners.name: Em Four
runners.spotlight: Overcame some problems in running to win a C&D apprentice handicap for Conor Whiteley nine days ago; an interesting contender off just 1lb higher.

runners.comment: 2-27; not that easy to win with but in the frame last five starts and has each-way chance
runners.name: Ziggys Condor
runners.spotlight: Not that easy to win with (2-27) but in the frame on last five starts, four on the AW; each-way contender.

runners.comment: Two 6f wins on turf in 2025; just as effective on the AW (close 3rd latest); chance
runners.name: Bill Plumb
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 6f at Yarmouth last year; just as effective on the AW and he finished a creditable third over this trip  at Newcastle latest when cheekpieces were added; a possible.

runners.comment: Won two 6f fillies' handicaps at Wolverhampton in 2025; has a stiffer task here
runners.name: Ziggys Queen
runners.spotlight: Won two 6f fillies' handicaps at Wolverhampton last year, the latest by a short head off 3lb lower in December; interesting but this looks a bit stronger.

runners.comment: Won two 6f handicaps on turf in 2025; also close second in two 7f AW h'caps; interesting
runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.spotlight: Won 6f handicaps at Nottingham and Chepstow last season (good); has been running over further since, twice finishing a close second over 7f at Kempton; interesting.

runners.comment: Ex-Harry Eustace; bought 11,000gns in October; unexposed and could improve for new yard
runners.name: Correspondence
runners.spotlight: Ex-Harry Eustace; bought for 11,000gns in October; now has first run for new (in-form) yard, having shown plenty of promise in maiden/novice company at up to 7f last season; still unexposed; quite interesting.

runners.comment: 1-20, winning at Wetherby in June; couple of good AW runs since, but not so good recently
runners.name: Atomic Mass
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-20, his win coming at Wetherby in June (5.5f, good to firm); had plenty of chances since, finishing runner-up in two 6f handicaps on Southwell AW last summer, but hasn't fared quite as well recently.

runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner (last win in December 2024); well beaten after a break last time
runners.name: Man On A Mission
runners.spotlight: Has won seven times on the AW, the most recent at Kempton in December 2024; some fair form since, but was well beaten on his return from a 275-day break last time; probably best watched for now.

14:42.race_name: Betfred The Classic Bookmaker Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Resurgent effort last weekend; gained only AW win off 6lb higher in sole C&D start
runners.name: Enthused
runners.spotlight: Posted a resurgent effort, albeit in a race that panned out favourably, at Lingfield (1m4f) last weekend; only 1-18 on AW but gained the win off 6lb higher in sole attempt over this C&D; possibilities.

runners.breeder: Qatar Bloodstock Ltd S A S U Ecurie De
runners.comment: Record of 2-3 at Wolverhampton but 0-11 elsewhere; form has dipped since last win
runners.name: Age Of Time
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 at Wolverhampton but 0-11 elsewhere and form has dipped since scoring in first-time cheekpieces in October; removal of that headgear needs to have a positive effect in two ways.

runners.comment: Placed at Wolverhampton the last twice, collared on the line latest; back in form
runners.name: Seraphic
runners.spotlight: Scored on AW in autumn 2024 and turf in spring 2025; back in form having been placed at Wolverhampton (9.5f) the last twice, collared on the line by a subsequent winner latest occasion; solid chance.

runners.comment: Has taken her form to a new level with a win and two good efforts, latest yesterday
runners.name: Three On Thursday
runners.spotlight: Has taken her form to a new level with an account-opening win at Lingfield (1m2f) and two good efforts (1m4f/1m), latest back at Lingfield yesterday; enters calculations if turning out quickly.

runners.breeder: Dullingham Park Stud & Mystic Mares Ltd
runners.comment: Three wins on turf; has made the frame in six of his nine AW attempts; in the mix
runners.name: Twilight Guest
runners.spotlight: Completed a turf hat-trick last May/June; has made the frame in six of his nine AW attempts, including over C&D when last seen three months ago (winner has franked the form); in the mix.

15:12.race_name: Betfred Bet Builder Classified Stakes (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Off the mark at the 27th attempt at Southwell on Tuesday; leading claims under 4lb penalty
runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.spotlight: In good form in handicaps (including on Polytrack elsewhere) prior to getting off the mark in a classified at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) on Tuesday; that was a first win at the 27th attempt and he carries a 4lb penalty today but he's a leading contender nevertheless.

runners.comment: Tailed off over C&D last time but had an excuse; in good heart previously; possible player
runners.name: Al Shabab
runners.spotlight: Tailed off over C&D last month but was trapped wide without cover and failed to settle; in good heart previously and he won a handicap at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) in September; possible player in his first classified.

runners.comment: Down the field at Southwell on Tuesday but ran well here previously; not a forlorn hope
runners.name: Come To Pass
runners.spotlight: 7yo with a poor strike-rate and he was down the field at Southwell on Tuesday; however, prior to that he ran well for a long way here following a very long absence and he might not be a forlorn hope now back here.

runners.comment: Two classified wins early last year and capable if back on song in reapplied cheekpieces
runners.name: Marinakis
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on last two starts but may have needed the run at Southwell last Sunday, which was his first outing since July; won two classified races early last year (1m/9.4f, including here) and he's capable if back on song in the reapplied cheekpieces, in which he posted his last win.

runners.comment: Running well in the main in second half of 2025; 2m has stretched him on last two starts
runners.name: Prince Hector
runners.spotlight: Running well in defeat in the main in the second half of last year, including over C&D, and 2m has stretched him on his last two outings; could be in the mix now back down in distance.

runners.comment: Runner-up twice in a row early last year but unable to reproduce that form since
runners.name: Sun Festival
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice in a row at Wolverhampton early last year but unable to reproduce that form since and remains winless since September 2023 (which came over C&D); makes first appearance since last July; others preferred.

runners.comment: 50-1 third at Lingfield last month; this C&D winner could be thereabouts if backing it up
runners.name: Sunset In Paris
runners.spotlight: Won Wolverhampton classified (9.4f, Tapeta) last June and returned to form with 50-1 third in Lingfield handicap (1m2f, Polytrack) four weeks ago; this C&D could be thereabouts if backing up his latest effort.

runners.comment: Well beaten at 125-1 at Lingfield (2m) on handicap debut; hard to fancy on stable debut
runners.name: Mary Rose
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on all four starts (1m2f-2m), most recently at 125-1 on handicap debut at Lingfield (2m, AW); has since left Brett Johnson (still in same ownership); drops back in trip for stable debut but hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Respectable 4th at Lingfield after some time off but now 0-8 and needs a bigger run here
runners.name: Spaceage Love Song
runners.owner: M L W Bell Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Returned from some time off with respectable fourth in handicap at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack last Saturday); however, this 4yo is 0-8 and will need a career-best performance if he's to get off the mark today.

15:42.race_name: Betfred Goals Galore Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Only 1-14 on AW but gained the win off 1lb higher and Charlie Bell takes off 7lb today
runners.name: Diamondonthehill
runners.spotlight: Respectable third, beaten only 1l, at Wolverhampton (7f) five days ago; only 1-14 on AW but gained the win off 1lb higher and Charlie Bell takes off 7lb today; fighting chance.

runners.comment: Successful over C&D when last seen, taking form figures at Chelmsford to 141; respected
runners.name: Commander Of Life
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return to AW in C&D event when last seen three months ago, taking record in this sphere to 3-21 and form figures at Chelmsford to 141; respected assuming he picks up where he left off.

runners.comment: Dropped away and finished last at Southwell on stable/seasonal debut; hood applied
runners.name: Rochelle
runners.spotlight: Has been unable to sustain a progressive start to her career; dropped away and finished last at Southwell (6f) on stable/seasonal debut; fitting of hood needs to prompt a turnaround.

runners.comment: Largely consistent since last win; beaten only a neck at Newcastle most recently; solid
runners.name: Benacre
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-14 on AW; largely consistent since last win and beaten only a neck at Newcastle (7f) most recently; ties in with Commander Of Life on C&D running in October; solid claims.

runners.comment: Solid second at Lingfield when last seen (final start for George Boughey); one to consider
runners.name: North View
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner who has been placed (over 7f/1m) in four of his six AW attempts; solid second at Lingfield when last seen three months ago (form franked by the winner since); sold out of George Boughey's yard for 26,000gns later in October; one to consider.

runners.comment: Ran respectably the last twice and remains on last winning mark; enters the reckoning
runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.spotlight: Has recorded all wins at about 1m but ran respectably over 7f at Chelmsford and Lingfield the last twice, beaten only about 1l both times; remains on last winning mark; enters the reckoning.

runners.comment: Inconsistent last year but latest effort can be forgiven; well treated on peak form
runners.name: Tolstoy
runners.spotlight: Far from consistent last year but latest effort can be forgiven (hampered, unable to recover); being 9lb below last winning mark helps to reflect that he's very well treated on peak form.

runners.comment: Commended his 2026 in the perfect way by registering a fourth C&D success; not ruled out
runners.name: Revolutionise
runners.spotlight: Retains plenty of vitality despite his advancing years; commenced his 2026 campaign in the perfect way by registering a fourth C&D success and taking record to 12-87; back up in class but not ruled out.

runners.comment: Usually races over 6f but appears to stay 7f; currently in a consistent vein of form
runners.name: Monsieur Kodi
runners.spotlight: Usually races over 6f but appears to stay 7f; currently in a consistent vein of form, keeping-on second with cheekpieces applied at Newcastle most recently; again has place claims.

runners.comment: Chance depends on whether the first crack at 7f elicits a resumption of progress
runners.name: Cherry Cobbler
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who showed promise over 1m on debut; campaigned at sprint trips since, winning once (5f); not disgraced in series final at Chelmsford (6f) most recently; chance depends on whether the first crack at 7f elicits a resumption of progress.

runners.comment: Made all at Kempton on stable debut; unable to dominate when below par later in October
runners.name: Kit Gabriel
runners.spotlight: Both starts for new stable at Kempton (7f) in October, making all on first occasion and unable to dominate when below-par favourite latest; chance may depend on whether he gets his own way up front.

runners.comment: C&D winner; hindered by wide trip here last time but again has the worst of the draw
runners.name: Chola Empire
runners.spotlight: Record of 5-32 on AW, the most recent win over C&D in October; hindered by wide trip back here (race won by Revolutionise) last time; again has the worst of the draw, however.

16:12.race_name: Betfred Play Fred's £5 Million Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Disappointing at Newcastle (5f) last time and he's untried at this trip; new headgear
runners.name: Last Outlaw
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner (5f) in 2024 but he's 0-6 on AW and was laboured after a slow start at Newcastle ten days ago; continues to drop down the weights but he's untried at this trip and others are more convincing; cheekpieces are removed and hood is now tried.

runners.comment: Six-time AW winner who didn't much luck at Lingfield latest; in the mix off dangerous mark
runners.name: Global Warning
runners.spotlight: All six wins have been on AW including four over 7f; last success was in September 2024 but he's well treated on old form and didn't get much luck when joint-favourite at Lingfield (fifth of 12) last month; should get a decent tow into this race and has possibilities if he gets the breaks.

runners.comment: Sole win was in a 2yo maiden and had form figures of 866600 last year; passed over
runners.name: Blueandtangerine
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in a 2yo maiden and she had form figures of 866600 last year; has dropped a long way in the weights but she was always in rear at Southwell (7f, AW) last month and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Losing run is up to 22 but he went close at Lingfield (7f) last Sunday; respected
runners.name: Kondratiev Wave
runners.spotlight: Losing run is up to 22 but he's reached the frame in his last three starts, including a close call at Lingfield (7f; visor reapplied) last Sunday; only 1lb higher here and he's a major player if he can repeat that latest form.

runners.comment: Dual 7f winner who ran well over 6f at Newcastle latest; dangerous back up in trip
runners.name: Diligent Henry
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been over 7f at Wolverhampton and latest was in October; held in four runs since that last success but he ran well over 6f at Newcastle ten days ago and this step back up in trip is a positive; dangerous in change of headgear.

runners.comment: 0-10 but he finished close up in first-time blinkers at Newcastle last time; possibilities
runners.name: Strobelight
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he responded well to first-time blinkers when a close fifth at Newcastle (7f) 13 days ago; on unchanged mark and he could make another bold bid back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Completed a double at Lingfield on Saturday and he's a big player again back in a handicap
runners.name: Secret Road
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 8yo who made it 2-4 for James Owen when completing a double with a cosy win in a classified event at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) on Saturday; this is his third run in eight days but he defied a wide draw last time and still looks feasibly treated back in a handicap; big player.

runners.comment: Brighton winner but he was well held on AW in final two runs in the autumn; down the list
runners.name: Campani
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough with hood added at Brighton (6f, good) in August but he was never involved back on AW (1m/7f) in his final two runs in the autumn; still has low mileage but he's 0-5 in this sphere and has bit to prove after a break; headgear removed.

runners.comment: Well below form in last four runs and needs to rediscover his spark
runners.name: Up The Monk
runners.spotlight: Good start for Mick Appleby included a Southwell win (6f, AW) in August but he's been well below form in his last three runs; now 4lb lower than for his win but he has a patchy profile and needs to rediscover his spark.

runners.comment: 17-race maiden and she's been out of sorts in both runs for current yard; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Tootsie
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on her best form for Tim Easterby but she's still a maiden after 17 starts and has been out of sorts in both runs for current yard; tongue-tie is now added and she needs a major revival back in trip.

runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who has finished down the field in her four handicaps; others preferred
runners.name: Fidget Lady
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in her qualifying runs and she's not finished closer than seventh in four Tapeta handicaps (5f-7f); still lightly raced but she needs a transformation on this switch to Polytrack.

16:42.race_name: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Running well on AW and turf early last summer; lesser runs without cheekpieces since
runners.name: Rainwater
runners.spotlight: Acts here but sole AW win at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f); in good heart on AW and turf last summer, in cheekpieces, but lesser efforts without headgear since and may need aids refitted before recapturing form.

runners.comment: Has dropped a long way in the weights and 3rd in good race for the grade over C&D latest
runners.name: Al Waqidi
runners.spotlight: Won first two starts for Charlie Appleby as a 2yo and 3yo but not seen again until last January; in the wilderness for much of the time since but now 30lb lower than 12 months ago and was running in a good race for the grade when third over C&D latest (favourite); looks sure to be involved.

runners.comment: Sole win over 7f at Wolverhampton; some fair runs for this yard; worth another go at 1m
runners.name: Simply Blue
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Wolverhampton (7f) in October on final start for previous yard; some respectable efforts for this one over a range of trips and in different types of headgear, keeping on well enough over 7f at Southwell last week to be worth another go at 1m; on the premises.

runners.comment: Promising yard debut over 7f at Kempton; dead-heated over 1m1f since; solid chance
runners.name: Galaxy Wonder
runners.spotlight: Versatile regarding tactics; sole Irish win at about 1m1f (turf) but he ran promisingly over 7f at Kempton on yard debut before dead-heating at Wolverhampton (extended 1m1f; pair clear) 16 days ago, showing enough pace to think he can be effective at 1m; back up 6lb; solid chance.

runners.comment: Well treated on best Tapeta form in 2025; promising latest; now has first run on Polytrack
runners.name: Miners Gamble
runners.spotlight: Turf winner at 1m1f in 2024; well treated on the pick of his 1m and 1m2f form on Newcastle AW last year and his latest run there (1m) was his best since back from a break; now needs to repeat it on Polytrack debut.

runners.comment: Good 3rd (1m) then won over 7f at Lingfield; behind at Wolverhampton since; not discounted
runners.name: Fulford Cross
runners.spotlight: Quite lightly raced; had some ordinary results when first handicapping but his Lingfield third (1m) was better and he was better than the bare result when getting up close home there (7f) in December; never sighted at Wolverhampton since but not discounted back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Has won at 1m on turf; both AW wins at 7f but return to this trip is worth investigating
runners.name: Tam Lin
runners.spotlight: Won big-field 1m turf handicap at Bellewstown in 2025 but both AW wins at 7f; close up over that trip at Lingfield (no cheekpieces, refitted now) for new yard but the return to 1m is worth investigating; thereabouts.

runners.comment: Three wins at about 1m since last February; acts here but seems best on Tapeta so far
runners.name: Brinton
runners.spotlight: Three wins at about 1m since last February, on Tapeta and turf; has form on this track but best AW efforts so far have come on the other surface which leaves her with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Had excuses of late but has won 3 times here, the latest over C&D in October
runners.name: Kessaar Power
runners.spotlight: Well held on latest three runs, including over C&D, but he's had excuses each time and is worth a second look back here where he's won three times (6f and 1m), most recently in October; can be competitive.

13:00.race_name: Betting.Bet Betting Site Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Brings a solid record; scored at Ffos Las switched to hurdles most recently; respected
runners.name: Legendary Luke
runners.spotlight: Brings a solid record, with his second in a bumper flanked by point/hurdle wins; turned over an odds-on shot at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) most recently and warrants respect with further improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Won easily on debut for new yard and subsequent effort needs marking up; major player
runners.name: The Cistercian
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 6yo who scored easily at Leicester (heavy) on debut for new yard; subsequent effort (again over 1m7f) needs marking up as he was badly hampered; major form contender back up in distance.

runners.comment: Something to find on his Newbury effort but Flat form suggests better is likely
runners.name: Contacto
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
runners.spotlight: Jumped novicey on his way to finishing fourth at Newbury (2m) on hurdles/stable debut; something to find on that effort but Flat form (fairly useful) suggests he should do better.

runners.comment: Irish point form has substance; possibly needed the run on rules debut
runners.name: For Old Times Sake
runners.spotlight: Placed in a couple of Irish points and that form has substance; down the field in Huntingdon novice hurdle (2m) for notable new connections but possibly needed the run and is open to improvement.

runners.comment: Modest fourth in Fontwell novice hurdle for new yard
runners.name: Herbygoesbananas
runners.spotlight: Raced twice for Chris Gordon, winning bumper at Huntingdon then well beaten in Flat event; modest fourth in Fontwell novice hurdle (2m1f) for new yard; likely one for handicaps later on.

runners.breeder: F Aimez Mme L Aimez P Aimez
runners.comment: Has a poor chance on his Plumpton efforts
runners.name: Le Flying Ferret
runners.spotlight: Has a poor chance on his Plumpton efforts (bumper/hurdle).

runners.breeder: Philippe Decouz & Scea Du Bas Bugey
runners.comment: Ex-French maiden; has posted encouraging efforts at Plumpton for new stable; in the mix
runners.name: Manigod
runners.spotlight: Ex-French maiden who has posted encouraging efforts at Plumpton (2m4f) for new stable, finishing second both times and showing clear signs that there may be a race of this nature in him; shortlisted.

runners.comment: From a good family but has severe limitations judged on his bumper form
runners.name: Monansunu
runners.spotlight: From a good family but has severe limitations judged on his bumper form that includes a modest third at Fontwell; needs improvement for the switch to hurdles.

runners.comment: Solid second in Irish point; subsequently sold for £70,000; interesting rules debutant
runners.name: Mr Finch
runners.spotlight: Showed clear promise in Irish point 11 weeks ago, beating all bar an odds-on shot who has since finished second in Newbury novice hurdle for this yard; subsequently sold for £70,000; interesting rules debutant.

runners.comment: Beaten long way in both outings
runners.name: Pacman
runners.spotlight: Beaten long way in both outings; dismal claims.

runners.comment: Placed twice (Flat/bumper) in France; absent since April 2024; best watched
runners.name: Roi Lion
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in France, placed twice (Flat/bumper) in 2022; absent since chase defeat in April 2024; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Best bumper form is nothing out of the ordinary but he's bred to do better over jumps
runners.name: Western George
runners.spotlight: Clear best effort in bumpers when third at Carlisle on penultimate occasion; that form is nothing out of the ordinary but he's in good hands and bred to do better over jumps.

13:30.race_name: Betting.Bet New Betting Sites Handicap Chase

runners.comment: On a four-timer so progressing; unraced beyond 3m so will need to get home
runners.name: Roe And Co
runners.spotlight: 4lb higher than when all out to complete his hat-trick at Leicester (2m6f, good to firm; won a point on soft) but the front two were clear and he's very lightly raced for one of his age; unraced beyond 3m so will need to get home.

runners.comment: Feasibly treated but he's pulled up in his last two races over fences
runners.name: The Scorpion King
runners.spotlight: Course winner and added 3m/3m1f chases last winter on testing ground; well handicapped on all that but he's pulled up in his last two races over fences and the fourth over hurdles was nothing to shout about.

runners.comment: Dual course winner; runner-up in two of his last three races, the latest over C&D
runners.name: Record High
runners.spotlight: Won his bumper here and added a C&D chase 11 months ago; runner-up in two of his last three races, the latest over C&D when only three completed but he did push the winner close; solid claims.

runners.comment: Poor last time but previous two efforts weren't too shoddy; on a career-low mark
runners.name: Animal
runners.spotlight: First two runs of the season weren't that bad given the company he was in but he ran no race last time at Wincanton, albeit under an inexperienced amateur; wouldn't be too dismissive off a career-low mark with Charlie Deutsch taking over.

runners.comment: Has won a chase but pulled up the last and hasn't been in great form over hurdles
runners.name: Cooleenymore
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner over 3m1f on good ground and a chase winner over 3m on heavy; pulled up in her last run over fences more than a year ago and recent hurdling exploits leave her with much to prove.

runners.comment: Only 3-1 at Uttoxeter last time and was reportedly suffering from sinus issues
runners.name: Innisfree Lass
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; 0-8 as a chaser and her second over C&D in November was remote, though did run well for a long way; only 3-1 at Uttoxeter last time and was reportedly suffering from sinus issues; has a chance.

runners.comment: Positives to take from his Southwell third as ran as though that race after a layoff
runners.name: Inedit De Mee
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 7yo who is 0-10 overall; positives to take from his Southwell third as ran as though that race after a layoff would bring him on (3m, good to soft); considered.

runners.breeder: Mrs Tessa Greatrex & Mr D Futter
runners.comment: An 11yo now but if on his game (wasn't last time) then he'd have a chance
runners.name: To Be Sure
runners.spotlight: Consistent 10yo who responded well for pressure to not be beaten far over 3m2f at Chepstow in October (good to firm; won on soft) but he ran no race at Fakenham three weeks ago, where jumping out to his right on occasions didn't help (ran well there on his previous visit); an 11yo now but if on his game he'd have a chance.

runners.comment: Tailed off on debut over regulation fences in a 2m7f handicap at Taunton 12 days ago
runners.name: Only Gossip
runners.spotlight: Did win a point but she was limited over hurdles and finished tailed off on debut over regulation fences in a 2m7f handicap at Taunton 12 days ago.

runners.comment: Poor hurdler; did finish second in an Irish hunter chase but in April 2024
runners.name: The Brickey Ranger
runners.spotlight: Forgettable form over hurdles includes two handicaps (2m3f/2m5f); could improve for fences given he went close in an Irish hunter chase, but that was in April 2024; limited appeal.

14:00.race_name: Betting.Bet Best Betting Sites Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qual') (GBB) (Div I)

runners.comment: Plumpton bumper winner and followed up here over 2m3f; shapes like a stayer
runners.name: Queens Theatre
runners.spotlight: This Plumpton bumper winner followed up over 2m3f here (heavy) a month ago when she shaped like a stayer in forging clear late on; carries a penalty but in a race lacking any depth.

runners.comment: Hood fitted after racing freely in a Listed bumper; positives from her previous runs
runners.name: Ajs Diamond
runners.spotlight: The pick of her bumper form is right up there in this company and she was too free when below par in a Listed race at Huntingdon last time; the hood looks an interesting addition for this hurdling debut; couldn't rule out.

runners.comment: 66-1 and trailed home last in a Listed bumper at Huntingdon
runners.name: Bunny Bee
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and trailed home last in a Listed bumper at Huntingdon, finishing behind a below-par Aj's Diamond.

runners.comment: Respected pedigree but the sole runner lacking any experience and can only be watched
runners.name: Casts Georgie
runners.owner: Sue & Clive Cole & Ann & Tony Gale
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George mare and the first foal out of a Listed-placed French/German 1m2f-1m4f Flat and British 2m/2m4f hurdle winner; the sole runner lacking any experience and can only be watched.

runners.comment: Limited Flat performer; huge odds and has shown nothing so far over hurdles
runners.name: Ephyra
runners.spotlight: Placed at a lowly level on the Flat for David Menuisier; huge odds and has shown nothing so far over hurdles.

runners.comment: Showed a bit in a point bumper but failed to complete once sent over jumps
runners.name: Geordies Betty
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit in a point bumper but failed to complete once sent over jumps; very opposable on this rules debut.

runners.comment: Chepstow bumper winner (good) who was nailed on the line at Wincanton (2m5f)
runners.name: Limerick Lass
runners.spotlight: Chepstow bumper winner (good) who was nailed on the line at Wincanton (2m5f, good to soft) and that form reads well, with the winner successful the time before and the third a winner since; shouldn't be troubled by this drop in trip and must have strong claims.

runners.comment: Nothing in bumpers and 150-1 when pulled up on hurdle/stable debut at Wincanton
runners.name: Mistress Fox
runners.spotlight: Finished last in two bumpers for previous yard and was 150-1 when pulled up on hurdle/stable debut at Wincanton.

runners.comment: Two bumper runs; debut third doesn't look strong now and then well held at Plumpton
runners.name: Svelte Silhouette
runners.spotlight: The form of her bumper third at Wincanton has taken some knocks and she was well held at Plumpton; goes hurdling without the hood she's sported thus far.

runners.comment: 33-1 and was last to finish on stable debut in a novice at Wincanton
runners.name: Wassailing Along
runners.spotlight: Modest RPR when third in a bumper for Anthony Honeyball; 33-1 and was last to finish on stable debut in a novice at Wincanton.

14:30.race_name: Betting.Bet Best Betting Sites Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qual') (GBB) (Div II)

runners.comment: Won at Ludlow on reappearance then went close in Listed grade at Haydock; the form pick
runners.name: Park Princess
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Ludlow (2m5f; hurdles debut) on return from lengthy absence; went very close in Listed grade at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) since; the form pick dropped back further in distance.

runners.comment: Has shown clear promise, most recently fourth at Southwell switched to hurdles
runners.name: Blue Marvel
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced mare who has shown clear promise, most recently fourth at Southwell (2m4f; hurdles debut) when shaping as if this return to shorter will prove ideal; again has frame possibilities.

runners.comment: Produced the best finishing kick in Kelso bumper for Stuart Crawford; open to progress
runners.name: Cushendall
runners.spotlight: Produced the best finishing kick and comfortably beat three rivals in Kelso bumper (2m, good) last May in sole start for Stuart Crawford; the form lacks strength but she's open to progress; now goes in hood.

runners.comment: Has no form claims and badly lacks recent match practice
runners.name: Dont Cheddar Tear
runners.spotlight: Has no form claims and badly lacks recent match practice having been absent since a heavy defeat over C&D 14 months ago.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner in France; last of four finishers over hurdles on British debut
runners.name: Holetown
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner (and otherwise often highly tried) in France; last of four finishers in Leicester novice hurdle (2m4f) on British/seasonal debut but may do better with the outing under her belt.

runners.comment: Better effort in bumpers when third at Ascot on debut; returns from long layoff
runners.name: Khutulun Khan
runners.spotlight: Raced twice in bumpers two seasons ago, better effort when third at Ascot on debut; that form gives her place possibilities on return from long layoff; market may offer further guidance.

runners.comment: Irish point winner; runner-up at Leicester switched to rules; likely capable of progress
runners.name: Onefournine
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in 2024 then sold for £170,000; no match for the winner in Leicester maiden hurdle (1m7f) switched to rules but is likely to build on that effort and show progress; one of the main contenders.

runners.breeder: Lasnawood Ltd & Tullis Park Rose Ltd
runners.comment: Five-time Flat winner; modest effort in sole hurdles attempt
runners.name: Shalfa
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner but nothing out of the ordinary in terms of ability; modest fifth at Plumpton 20 months ago in sole hurdles attempt.

runners.comment: Modest third at Plumpton switched to this code
runners.name: Yasmina
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden on Flat; modest third at Plumpton (2m) on the switch to hurdles; others have stronger claims.

runners.comment: Weak claims on Flat form; beaten long way on hurdles debut
runners.name: Flame Dancer
runners.spotlight: Beaten long way in juvenile maiden hurdle at Doncaster, having gone into it with weak claims on Flat form.

15:00.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Maiden; ran a sound race on first try at 3m1f when second last time; chance on that form
runners.name: Woodythewoodpecker
runners.spotlight: Maiden; ran his best race since going handicapping when second to a progressive sort on soft at Hereford last time (first run at 3m1f); chance on that form.

runners.comment: 3-23 over hurdles; has won here, also won over 3m1f; fair form recently; each-way chance
runners.name: Bobalot
runners.spotlight: Not the best of strike-rates; won here in January 2024 (2m5f, soft) and has also won over 3m1f; fair form recently; each-way chance.

runners.comment: Unexposed; fair second of three on h'cap debut last time (2m4f); may improve up to 3m1f
runners.name: Fox Cottage
runners.spotlight: Unexposed; fair second of three to a subsequent winner at Leicester on his handicap debut last time (2m4f, soft); may improve again now up to 3m1f; quite interesting.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Saubouas
runners.comment: Unexposed; modest efforts so far but may improve now up in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Mr Griffiths
runners.spotlight: Unexposed; modest efforts in maiden/novice company but is interesting up in trip for handicap debut; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Unexposed; well beaten both starts for current yard; headgear tried; bit to prove
runners.name: Jour dOrage
runners.spotlight: Unexposed; well beaten on both starts for current yard, including when stepped up to 2m7f on handicap debut at Lingfield last time (good to soft; jumped right); cheekpieces now tried; bit to prove.

runners.comment: Off the mark at Wincanton last time; up 8lb but should give another good account
runners.name: Happy Returns
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 13th attempt when winning in good style at Wincanton last time (3m, good to soft); should go well despite 8lb rise.

runners.breeder: John Goodman & The Late Owen Brennan
runners.comment: Improved form when well-backed winner at Leicester in November; not so good last time
runners.name: Jewel Eyed Judy
runners.spotlight: Seemed to show improved form when well-backed winner at Leicester in November (2m4f, soft; second went on to win two chases); fared less well when only fourth of five over same C&D next time; returns to this longer trip (pulled up after being hampered previous run at 3m1f).

runners.comment: Ex-Robert Stephens; two wins in 2023 but bit disappointing since; a possible on yard debut
runners.name: Wot You Wearing
runners.spotlight: Ex-Robert Stephens; in good form in 2023 with two wins at about 2m4f at Chepstow (soft/heavy); bit disappointing since; has first run for new yard here; could go well despite 273-day break.

runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner over 2m; not as good over hurdles; first run over this trip
runners.name: Smith
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner over 2m on AW at Lingfield; not as good over hurdles so far (pulled up at Plumpton last April on latest start); needs to improve for step up in trip.

runners.comment: Only win was a chase in France 2022; mainly below form last year; hard to fancy
runners.name: I Love You Sivola
runners.spotlight: Only win came in a chase in France in December 2022; mainly below his best last year; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Yet to win for this yard; sound run on last season's reappearance; now 10lb lower; chance
runners.name: William Philo
runners.spotlight: Won a hurdle here (2m5f) and a chase for Robert Walford; best run last season when second at Exeter on reappearance in January (2m5f, soft; 125-1); disappointing after that; 10lb lower now and could go well after another break.

runners.comment: Both wins have been at Plumpton; poor form after long break this term; best watched
runners.name: Hilltown
runners.spotlight: Both wins (hurdle and chase) have been over 3m1f at Plumpton; well below his best since returning in November after a long break.

15:30.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Extra Places Paid Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Has won three over hurdles (2mf/3m); acts well on soft; interesting now going chasing
runners.name: Alright Dai
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles last season (2m4f, good to soft/soft) and got off the mark for this campaign when winning 3m handicap at Taunton last time; interesting now going chasing.

runners.comment: Flat/hurdle winner; fair fourth both chase starts; needs to improve to take this
runners.name: Sanitiser
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner; fair fourth on both starts over fences, the first over this C&D; needs to improve a little to take this.

runners.comment: Hurdles winner here; fair over fences, but not always a fluent jumper; a possible
runners.name: Summer In Milan
runners.owner: The Les & Jan Gilbert Racing Legacy
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles in first-time visor here last March (2m5f, good); fair form in five attempts over fences, but tends to jump right and make a few errors; fair second of three at Plumpton last time (2m4f, good to soft); a possible.

runners.comment: Fair over hurdles and beaten 25l on chase debut; should improve and worth considering
runners.name: Roxhill
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer; only fair form over hurdles; beaten 25l on chase debut at Stratford in October (2m6f, good to soft; not entirely fluent); should improve and is worth considering.

runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner; won Lingfield chase in 2024; below par since; headgear now tried
runners.name: Angels Dream
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who got off the mark over fences when a 22-1 winner at Lingfield in November 2024 (2m, soft); well beaten both starts since; bit to prove up in trip with cheekpieces now tried.

runners.comment: Two wins and four places over fences last term; should go well on ground that suits
runners.name: Everyonesacritic
runners.spotlight: Took well to chasing last season with wins at Hereford (2m5f, good to soft) and Leicester (2m4f, heavy); hasn't hit top form so far this season, but is back on a decent mark and should go well on ground that suits.

runners.comment: Two wins on heavy in 2024; not progressed and below par after wind op this term
runners.name: Hatos
runners.spotlight: Experienced chaser; two wins on heavy in February 2024 (2m/1m7f); mixed form since but rather disappointing this season after having wind surgery; bit to prove.

16:00.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Money Back Specials Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Had wind surgery since winning a maiden hurdle last March; open to further progress
runners.name: I Play County
runners.spotlight: Absent and had wind surgery since winning a maiden hurdle at Southwell (2m, good to soft) ten months ago, taking overall record to 3-6; bred to be as effective back up in trip and looks open to further progress.

runners.comment: Beaten only a whisker on reappearance but this 9yo is now on a career-high mark
runners.name: Casts Tasha
runners.owner: Sue & Clive Cole & Ann & Tony Gale
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-19 includes a Ffos Las win during a light 2024-25 campaign; beaten only a whisker by the favourite at Leicester (2m4f, soft) on reappearance but this 9yo is now on a career-high mark.

runners.comment: Record suggests he's best caught fresh; interesting handicap debutant on return from break
runners.name: Kajikia
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo; distant second when bidding for a Plumpton double last time but record suggests he may be best caught fresh; hence looks an interesting handicap debutant on return from 83-day break.

runners.comment: C&D success last March in sole Fontwell start; staying-on fourth over 2m most recently
runners.name: Activist
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-17 over hurdles, the most recent success over C&D (good to soft) last March in sole Fontwell start; respectable staying-on fourth over 2m at Chepstow last time; possibilities back in this scenario.

runners.comment: Reasonably consistent in points and maiden hurdles; may improve now handicapping
runners.name: Northanger Abbey
runners.spotlight: Reasonably consistent in points and maiden hurdles, making the frame each time; folded tamely the latest occasion but may finish to better effect and show improvement now handicapping.

runners.comment: Last of six finishers on stable/handicap debut but has low mileage and may do better
runners.name: Comanche Magic
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who still has low mileage; last of six finishers at Southwell (2m4f) on stable/handicap debut but was prominent in the betting and is seemingly thought capable of better.

runners.comment: Ran well at Plumpton (handicap debut) last time and the winner has franked the form since
runners.name: Kool Kid
runners.spotlight: Bumper scorer; spoiled his finishing effort by hanging but ran well on the figures at Plumpton (2m4f; handicap debut) most recently and the winner has franked the form by following up at Fontwell; major claims.

runners.comment: Both hurdles wins off 3lb lower in 2m1f events at Fontwell, latest on reappearance
runners.name: Calshot Spit
runners.spotlight: Has gained both hurdles wins off 3lb lower in 2m1f events at Fontwell, latest when narrowly beating Bridge on reappearance (heavy); back up the weights and in distance, he's perhaps one to take on.

runners.comment: Gained most recent win in small field at Exeter; well held at Hereford since
runners.name: Hillsin
runners.spotlight: Contrasting performances since rejoining this stable, holding on narrowly in small field at Exeter (2m2f) then soundly beaten at Hereford; not the percentage call in this competitive affair.

runners.comment: Has become inconsistent but is competitively weighted on best form
runners.name: Lexies Moon
runners.spotlight: Has become inconsistent but is competitively weighted on best form, such as defying a 2lb higher mark at Stratford (heavy) in October 2024; admittedly still seeking first win beyond 2m.

runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.comment: Reappearance effort took his Fontwell record to 122; this new trip is likely to suit
runners.name: Bridge
runners.spotlight: Lost out only narrowly in a tight finish with Calshot Spit on return from lengthy layoff, taking Fontwell record (2m1f) to 122 and again shaping as if this longer trip is worth exploring; solid claims.

runners.comment: Couple of third-place finishes over 2m for new yard; stamina to prove back up in trip
runners.name: Miss Maxfort
runners.spotlight: 2m winner in Ireland; couple of third-place finishes over same trip for new stable; appears to be in reasonably good form but doesn't shape as if she's crying out for this step back up in distance.

runners.comment: Has form figures of 112B at Fontwell, brought down three out back here last time
runners.name: Motazzen
runners.spotlight: Hurdles record is 3-16; has form figures of 112B at Fontwell, brought down three out when returned to this venue last time (2m3f; race won by Bradman); solid chance, assuming he gets better luck.

runners.comment: Juvenile hurdler who gained his 66-1 win at Fontwell; return to this course looks a plus
runners.name: Westlain
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdler who registered a 66-1 success at Fontwell (2m1f) with hood applied and faced a stiffer assignment at Cheltenham since; the return to this course and drop back in grade are positives.

runners.comment: Rather a fortuitous success over C&D on Boxing Day; no certainty to follow up
runners.name: Bradman
runners.spotlight: Opened his hurdles account in C&D contest (good to soft) on Boxing Day but was rather fortuitous, with three of his four rivals coming to grief three out; no certainty to follow up in this deeper field.
